ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I have done a lot of reading this semester, most books I read for the first time. I have learned about the thinkings of a number of giants in human history.

I learned how to relate anthropological theories with important philosophical works. I got to know that many current anthropological discussions have deep roots in Western tradition of thoughts. This course significantly deepened my understanding of anthropological theories.
An overview of social theory and the ability to link various thinkers together and apply them to my own work.
Creative engagement with materials and interdisciplinary thinking.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The workload is super high. The class is difficult to follow.

The strength is that the assigned readings are all closely related to each other and at the end of the course I got to see the connections between classic social theories. It might be improved if the instructor provides some helpful references to better understand the classic texts assigned as required readings.
Great links between social theory and anthropology!! Could be improved by more in depth discussions of respective materials!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Great course to learn about social theory development.

Yes. The instructor is able to respond to students' question accurately and informatively. He has wide and deep understanding of classic social theories and the skills to present them clearly and with much fun.
